page.title: 15USE OF THE LAND 11
page.content: Where possible,the area is extensively farmed.Even land which shows little potential,such as the valley of the Crinei brook in (96 35) which is an area of peat marsh and reeds,is used as rough grazing for store cattle.Esgyrn farm (96 34),has recently changed it's use to a deer farm,somewhat innovatory for the area.The perimeter of the farm now noticeably founded by 2m to 3m high deer fencing.With reference to agriculture,therefore,we suggest that few major changes have taken place.One modern developement is related to the possibility of part of the area becoming part of the L.F.A (Less Favoured Area)scheme.This title would apply to waste land,scrub,heath and stoney ground.Such areas occur in squares (9936)and(9935).
